review_title: You have to really love what you do.
job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in Bolivar, MO
pros: SBU gives great benefits to it's employees. Great summer hours, ability to attend chapel, and a great environment to share your faith.
cons: While I would love to give more pros than cons, I don't think that is possible. SBU is run like a family and as such sees a lot of issues. Your pay is low... it is mostly livable, but not worth it when the job requires a college degree. There is little job training/cross training but you are still expected to take over when there is open positions in your department. Very frequently, you will have to do your job and someone elses for the same low pay.

pros: Colleagues are wonderful to work with.
cons: Salary is atrocious. Expect more and more without salary increase. Haven't gotten a pay raise in 8 years.

pros: The teachers are Christ-Centered and subject matter experts.
cons: .The upper management is very rude and full of themselves, you can tell they are in in for money and that is all. .They will not let students move off campus because they need to fill their own dorms. .The dorms are very unsanitary and work orders are not filled.

pros: SBU has amazing employees. They work hard to accomplish the goals of SBU and prepare our students for success.
cons: Some disconnect from administration and struggle to get answers.

pros: Great work community. Everybody is dedicated to the student-centered mission!
cons: Minimal growth opportunities while taking on progressively more work to control costs.

pros: Great environment, great people, you will enjoy the work.
cons: They pay low on the scale, and rewards are not great.

review_title: People are nice, pay is horrible.
pros: People are nice and kind. They love their employees.
cons: Small town. Really bad pay. Only raise you will get is when minimum wage goes up.

pros: Students keep employees feeling young.

pros: Flexible hours, positive encouraging staff and supervisors, decent pay, working with your professors.

pros: SBU is incredibly friendly. Faculty are involved and encouraged to foster strong relationships with each other and with students.
cons: A lot is a top down policy. It is discouraged strongly to disagree with administration. Additionally, some see this university as more of a church rather than a university. There are some departments that put more balance into faith integration than others.
